Šepetalec torbicam obnorel modno industrijo
Kitajec je študijska leta preživel na Rodeo Drivu in se zaljubil v modo. Danes je znan kot gospod Torbica, zaupajo mu tudi modni velikani.
03 Nov 2019, 14:32 by E. B.



Tao Ling je pritegnil tudi modne velikane.



Namesto da bi študiral finance, se je ukvarjal z modo.


Ko kitajske mlade dame potrebujejo modni nasvet, jim lahko zanesljivo pomaga le ena oseba. Gospod Torbica! Tao Ling je veliki zvezdnik kitajskih družabnih omrežij in pravi poznavalec najbolj priljubljenih modnih dodatkov, ga hvalijo oboževalke, ki mu svoj videz zaupajo ob vsaki pomembni priložnosti.Tao je študijska leta preživel na losangeleški univerzi, prosti čas pa kakor vrstniki posvečal košarki in videoigricam. Pa še skriti strasti, dolgim sprehodom po znamenitem Rodeo Drivu, kjer je kupoval – torbice. Ali pa si jih je ogledoval in analiziral slog, a vsekakor je njegova ljubezen do ženskih modnih dodatkov prerasla v pravo obsesijo. Starši so mu sicer plačali drag študij na drugem koncu sveta, da bi se pripravil na svet financ, toda Tao se je v domovino vrnil oborožen s povsem drugim znanjem in izkušnjami. Sklenil je postati modni svetovalec in narekovalec smernic, med damami pa ima toliko oboževalk, da se ga je prijel vzdevek šepetalec torbicam!
Od Fendija do Givenchyja
Mr. Bags je zdaj njegovo uradno poimenovanje v modni industriji, doseglo pa je celo italijanskega velikana Fendi, ki ga je povabil na modno revijo v Milano. Prvič se je tako zgodilo, da je modni bloger sedel v prvi vrsti na Fendijevem šovu, dogodek pa ga je seveda le še utrdil na prestolu in mu privabil še več oboževalk. Zdaj mu zaupajo tudi kitajske zvezdnice in drugi modni


Namesto da bi študiral finance, se je ukvarjal z modo.

oblikovalci, med njimi Givenchy, ki je po Taovi zaslugi prodal za 150.000 evrov torbic v pičlih 12 minutah, italijanska blagovna znamka Tod's pa je v šestih minutah pridelala pol milijona evrov. »Vsak nakup mora imeti smisel,« pravo Tao. »Ženske pogosto kupujejo nepremišljeno in torbico potem morda obžalujejo. Jaz jim pomagam do trajnostne izbire, do prave naložbe. Upoštevajo pa me tudi zato, ker sem moški in jim svetujem resnično objektivno.«

The handbag whisperer has plagued the fashion industry
The Chinese man spent his academic years on the Rodeo Drive and fell in love with fashion. Today he is known as Mr. Handbag, and is also trusted by fashion giants.
03 Nov 2019, 14:32 by E. B.



Tao Ling has also attracted fashion giants.



Instead of studying finance, he worked in fashion.


When Chinese young ladies need fashion advice, only one person can reliably assist them. Mr Purse! Tao Ling is a big celebrity on Chinese social networking sites and a true connoisseur of the most popular fashion accessories, praised by fans who entrust him with his appearance at every important occasion.Tao spent his academic years at Los Angeles University and spent his free time as a basketball and video game peer. And even hidden passions, a long walk through the famous Rodeo Drive where he shopped - purses. Or he was looking at them and analyzing the style, but certainly his love for women's fashion accessories grew into a real obsession. Although his parents paid him expensive studies at the other end of the world to prepare for the world of finance, Tao returned home with a whole new set of knowledge and experience. He decided to become a fashion consultant and a dictator of guidelines, and there are so many fans among the ladies that he is nicknamed the handbag whisperer!
From Fendi to Givenchy
Mr. Bags is now his official name in the fashion industry, reaching even the Italian giant Fendi, who invited him to a Milan fashion show. It happened for the first time that the fashion blogger was sitting in the front row at Fendi's show, and the event, of course, only cemented him on the throne and attracted even more fans. He is now also credited with Chinese celebrities and other fashionistas


Instead of studying finance, he worked in fashion.

designers, including Givenchy, who sold $ 150,000 worth of handbags in just 12 minutes to Ta's credit, and Italian brand Tod's made half a million euros in six minutes. "Every purchase must make sense," says Tao. “Women often buy recklessly and then regret their purse. I help them make sustainable choices, make the right investment. But they also take me into consideration because I am a man and I give them real objective advice. "
